Class Node

java.lang.Object
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.node.Node
All Implemented Interfaces:
INode
Direct Known Subclasses:
PoWNode
public abstract class Node extends Object implements INode
Abstract class representing a node in a blockchain network.
Author:
Sotirios Liaskos for the Conceptual Modeling Group @ York University

    • getNextTransmissionEndTime

      public long getNextTransmissionEndTime(long currTime, long transDuration)
      Computes the end time of the next transmission starting at or after the given current time, taking into account the time until which the network interface is already busy.

      If the interface is free at currTime, meaning either it has never been used (busy time = -1) or its busy-until time is earlier than currTime, then the next transmission begins immediately at currTime and ends at currTime + transDuration.

      If the interface is still busy at currTime, the next transmission begins only after networkInterfaceBusyUntil, and ends at networkInterfaceBusyUntil + transDuration.

      Parameters:
      currTime - the current simulation time (must be ≥ 0)
      transDuration - the duration of the transmission (must be ≥ 0)
      Returns:
      the time at which the next transmission will end

    • setNetworkInterfaceBusyUntil

      public void setNetworkInterfaceBusyUntil(long latestBusyUntil)
      Sets the time until which the network interface is considered busy.

      A value of -1 may be used to indicate that the interface has never been used or is currently idle with no pending transmissions.

      Parameters:
      latestBusyUntil - the simulation time at which the interface will become free again

    • broadcastContainer

      public void broadcastContainer(ITxContainer txc, long time)
      Propagates the specified transaction container to other nodes in the simulation. TODO: All time references should be on a global time parameter.
      Parameters:
      txc - The transaction container to be propagated.
      time - The current simulation time.

    • broadcastTransaction

      public void broadcastTransaction(Transaction t, long time)
      Propagates the specified transaction to other nodes in the simulation.
      Parameters:
      t - The transaction to be propagated.
      time - The current time in the simulation.

    • getNextNodeID

    • resetCurrID

      public static void resetCurrID()
      Resets the next available ID to 1. To be used for moving to the next experiment.

    • setBehavior

      public void setBehavior(String behavior)
      Sets the behavior type of the node.

      The behavior string can be used by implementations to indicate different behavioral strategies (e.g., "Honest", "Malicious").

      Specified by:
      setBehavior in interface INode
      Parameters:
      behavior - the behavior type name
